Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In 11/2025, two youth were not following staff instructions and a
staff member attempted to separate them. The staff member's air
pod fell out of their ear and one of the youths picked it up and
refused to return it. The staff member attempted to retrieve it and
the youth responded with physical aggression. Two staff members
then restrained the youth and staff swapped out during this period
as well. The youth sustained a circular bruise on the right side of
the forearm. Youth was taken to the hospital for aggressive
behaviors. Law enforcement was also contacted.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 01/21/2025. Complainant did
not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 01/23/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth A
recalled an incident involving unit keys. Youth A stated Youth B
tried to grab the unit keys from Staff 4 and this caused Staff 4 to
slide the unit keys under the door. Youth A stated Youth B
became irate and hit Staff 4 in the face and Staff 4’s air pod fell
out of her ear to the ground. Youth A stated she picked up the air
pod because she did not want someone to step on it. Youth A
stated Staff 4 dug her nails into the top of Youth A’s left hand to
get the air pod back. Youth A stated Former Staff and Staff 2
physically managed her in a two-person standing hold when she
escalated after Staff 4 scratched her hand. Youth A stated she
was escalated because her grandmother used to dig her nails into
her. Youth A stated law enforcement arrived and transported her
to the hospital. Youth A stated she was evaluated and returned to
Vista Maria. Youth A stated the marks on her left hand healed.
2

There were no visible marks observed on Youth A’s left hand.
Youth A denied other injury in this incident.
Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on
01/27/2025 by phone. FCW stated Youth A never mentioned
being scratched on her hands during a physical management.
Youth B was interviewed on 02/12/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth B
stated she and Youth A were coloring by the unit door. Youth B
stated a staff (does not recall who) redirected Youth A and Youth
B to move away from the door for better line of sight. Youth B
stated she was irritated by this request and tried to grab the unit
keys from Staff 3. Youth B stated during this time Staff 4 dropped
her air pod on the ground and Youth A picked it up and refused to
give it back. Youth B stated Youth A was placed in a standing two-
person hold by Former Staff and a female staff (does not recall
who). Youth B stated Youth A struggled in the physical
management and tried to bite staff. Youth B stated Youth A was
released and staff then restrained Youth B when she kicked staff
while lying on the ground. Youth B stated law enforcement arrived
and transported Youth A and Youth B to the hospital.
Former Staff (FS) was interviewed on 02/03/2025 by phone. FS
stated he responded to an assistance call. FS stated Youth A had
something that she would not give back to staff but does not recall
the item. FS stated he and Staff 2 secured Youth A in a two-
person standing hold when Youth A became aggressive towards
Staff 2. FS stated he switched out of the hold after a minute with
Staff 5 because Youth B became aggressive towards him. FS
stated Youth A scratched his hand and arm. FS denied scratching
Youth A’s hand during the physical management. FS stated he did
not recall further details.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/23/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista
Representative. Staff 1 stated Staff 3 knocked on the door before
sliding the unit keys under the door and Staff 1 picked the keys up
on the other side. Staff 1 stated she then entered the unit to assist
and saw Youth A trying to assault Staff 4. Staff 1 stated staff (does
not recall who) stood between Youth A and Staff 4 creating a
barrier that allowed Staff 4 to leave the unit. Staff 1 stated Youth B
tried to grab and kick at staff while Youth A was in a standing two-
person hold and trying to bite staff (does not recall the other staff
involved). Staff 1 stated she stood in front of Youth A and verbally
de-escalated her. Staff 1 stated law enforcement arrived and took
Youth B to the hospital. Staff 1 did not recall if law enforcement
also took Youth A to the hospital. Staff 1 stated she noticed Youth
3

A’s hand was bleeding and asked what happened. Staff 1 stated
Youth A stated she did not know how the top of her left middle
finger below the middle knuckle was scratched. Staff 1 denied
seeing other marks on the top of Youth A’s right or left hand.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/23/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista
Representative. Staff 2 stated Youth A and Youth B are friends
and often act out together. Staff 2 stated she responded to an
assistance call. Staff 2 stated Youth A was verbally aggressive
due to Youth B being escalated for reasons unknown. Staff 2
stated she and FS secured Youth A in a two-person standing hold.
Staff 2 stated Youth A scratched Staff 2’s left hand and revealed a
small, healed mark under her left pinky finger. Staff 2 stated Youth
A went to the hospital after this incident. Staff 2 stated she does
not recall Youth A alleging FS scratched her hand or other injury
from the physical management.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 02/04/2025 by phone. Staff 3 stated
Youth B said, “Give me your keys bitch” as soon as she walked on
to the unit at the beginning of her shift. Staff 3 stated she told
Youth B that she could not give her the unit keys, put the keys in
her pocket and asked what was going on. Staff 3 stated she then
passed the keys to Staff 4 and Staff 4 slid the keys under the door
to the hallway. Staff 3 stated Youth A picked up Staff 4’s air pod
and argued about returning it. Staff 3 stated she knocked on the
door of the adjacent unit and left to hang up her coat once the
door opened. Staff 3 stated she returned to the unit and found
Youth A and Youth B swinging their arms towards staff and Youth
A spitting and trying to bite staff. Staff 3 stated FS and a female
staff (does not recall who) physically managed Youth A in a
standing two-person hold. Staff 3 stated Youth B pushed Staff 4
and was also physically managed but does not recall by which
staff. Staff 3 stated law enforcement arrived and transported
Youth A and Youth B to the hospital. Staff 3 stated Youth A did not
complain of injuries during this incident.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 02/12/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista
Representative. Staff 4 stated Youth A approached Staff 3 for the
unit keys when Staff 3 arrived on the unit because Youth A
wanted to go to another unit. Staff 4 stated she took the unit keys
from Staff 3 and slid them under a door. Staff 4 stated Youth A
grabbed at Staff 4’s crossbody purse and this caused Staff 4’s air
pod to fall to the ground. Staff 4 stated Youth A picked up the air
pod and refused to return it. Staff 4 stated she retrieved her air
pod from Youth A's hand and in the process Youth A bit Staff 4’s
left forearm. Staff 4 stated assistance was called and FS, Staff 1
4

and Staff 5 responded. Staff 4 stated FS did not physically
manage Youth A in this incident. Staff 4 stated law enforcement
was called and responded.
Staff 5 was interviewed on 02/12/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista
Representative. Staff 5 stated she responded to an assistance call
and switched out FS’s physical management hold on Youth A
because Youth A bit FS’s leg. Staff 5 stated Youth A continued to
focus on FS, which caused FS to leave the unit to assist in
redirecting Youth A's focus. Staff 5 stated she and Staff 2
continued holding Youth A in a two-person standing hold and
released her once she calmed down. Staff 5 stated Youth A did
not allege being injured in the physical management. Staff 5
stated she obtained Staff 4’s air pod from Youth A and returned it
to Staff 4.
Former Staff 2 is no longer employed at Vista Maria since
01/06/2025. Attempts were made on 02/03/2025 and 02/05/2025
to interview Former Staff 2. A message stated the number is not in
service and the call cannot be completed.
Unit Manager was interviewed on 01/23/2025 at Vista Maria with
Vista Representative. Unit Manager stated she heard a
commotion from her office and went to the unit. Unit Manager
stated Youth B tried to get the unit keys from Staff 4. Unit
Manager stated Youth B continued to go after staff causing Youth
A’s behavior to escalate. Unit Manager stated she does not recall
if Youth A or Youth B reported injuries from this incident.
Video
11/25/2024 video footage does not have sound. The video camera
provides a fishbowl view of the area with the focus on the common
area. Enlarging and zooming in on an area of the video footage is
not available. The video shows two youth and two staff on the unit
in the common area at approximately 3:02 PM. The youths and
staff go to the end of the hallway. One staff walks back up to the
common area and knocks on the door and exits. One staff and
two youths at the end of the hallway move back and forth in the
width of the hallway. Additional staff along with the staff that left
the unit arrive from the hallway door and the door in the common
area and position themselves in the hallway with the two youths.
Movement of staff and youth are seen at the end of the hallway.
Youth B lays on her back on the hallway ground without being
physically managed and kicks her legs toward nearby staff. Two
law enforcement officers arrive from the hallway door at
approximately 3:14 PM. Due to the location of the incident, the
5

physical management hold and specific interactions between
Youth A, Youth B, and staff cannot be clearly viewed.
Documentation
Former Staff, Staff 1 and Staff 3 wrote incident reports dated
11/25/2024 that coincide with their interviews except Staff 3’s
incident report stated Youth B secured the unit keys and Staff 4
grabbed them from Youth B.
Youth A does not have a nursing note following this 11/25/2025
incident because law enforcement transported her to the hospital.
Youth A’s hospital discharge paperwork dated 11/25/2024 states
Youth A has a small bruise on her forearm. It does not state
whether it is on her right or left forearm. It states Youth A did not
have complaints and wanted to return to Vista Maria. It states
Youth A was discharged back to Vista Maria. It does not
document scratch marks on Youth A’s left hand.
Vista Maria utilizes Crisis Prevention Institute – Nonviolent Crisis
Prevention Intervention.
• Former staff last completed physical management training
on 06/25/2024.
• Staff 2 last completed physical management training on
12/09/2024. Staff 2 does not have a discipline history.
Tour
Upon entering Faith wing, one stands in a short hallway with youth
bedrooms on the right. To the left of this hallway is a closet and
then a staff desk at the end of the hallway. The hallway leads to
the common area, which has several couches positioned to view
the television. Opposite the unit door is a large wall window.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance because it cannot be
determined how Youth A obtained the bruise on her forearm as
documented in her hospital discharge paperwork. Youth A did not
state she was bruised in this incident.
Youth A alleged Staff 4 scratched the top of her left hand and
caused it to bleed. Staff 1 recalled seeing the top of Youth A’s left
middle finger bleed from this incident. The hospital discharge
paperwork does not indicate Youth A with a scratch or blood on
her left hand. It cannot be definitively determined how or if Youth
A received a scratch on her the top of her left hand during this
incident.
6

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Employee policy and procedure manual states “Personal cell
phone use is only permitted during scheduled breaks and are not
allowed while in the presence of clients in any residential
program.” It is recommended for Vista Maria to clearly state if staff
are permitted to wear air pods on the unit, which may be
connected to a smart watch and impact youth supervision.
Employee policy and procedure manual states “Dress
appropriately for the job by wearing agency approved uniforms,
and/or clothing appropriate for the work being performed.” It is
recommended for Vista Maria to require staff to place personal
items like outdoor coats, purses, backpacks etc. in their locker and
not be permitted on the unit. Crossbody purse, as worn by Staff 4
in this incident, may interfere in youth restraints, be used as a
choking device or create temptation for a youth to obtain or obtain
objects inside.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code R 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160.
Section The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to: (a) An emergency response to protect the
youth or others from an unanticipated or severely aggressive
behavior that places the youth or others at serious threat of
violence or injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
Allegation Additional Finding
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 01/23/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth A
stated Former Staff and Staff 2 physically managed her in a two-
person standing hold because she “got mad” when Staff 4 dug her
nails into the top of her left hand to get the air pod back. (Youth A
did not say what she did when she got mad.)
Youth B was interviewed on 02/12/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth B
stated Youth A was placed in a standing two-person hold by
Former Staff and a female staff (does not recall who) when she
refused to give back Staff 4’s air pod.
7

Former Staff (FS) was interviewed on 02/03/2025 by phone. FS
stated he and Staff 2 secured Youth A in a two-person standing
hold when Youth A became argumentative and aggressive
towards Staff 2 and would not return something to staff. FS stated
he did not recall specific details because the incident occurred in
11/2024.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/23/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista
Representative. Staff 2 stated she and FS secured Youth A in a
two-person standing hold when Youth A was verbally aggressive.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 02/12/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista
Representative. Staff 4 stated she retrieved her air pod from
Youth A's hand. Staff 4 stated FS did not physically manage Youth
A.
Video
11/25/2024 video footage does not have sound. Enlarging and
zooming in on an area of the video footage is not available. Due to
the location of the incident, the physical management hold and
specific interactions between Youth A and staff cannot be clearly
viewed.
Document Review:
Former Staff wrote an incident report on 11/25/2024. It states
Youth A refused to return an item to staff. Staff attempted to
retrieve the item. Youth A was physically managed by Former
Staff and Staff 2 when Youth A began to assault staff.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 4 physically
retrieved her air pod from Youth A’s hand and allegedly scratched
Youth A’s hand in the process, which escalated Youth A, and
resulted in physical management of Youth A. Youth A was not a
risk to herself or others for having the air pod.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the
current license status be continued.
